19.82. Let h∗(G) denote the generalized Fitting height of a finite group G defined
as the minimum number k such that F∗k(G) = G, where F∗1(G) = F∗(G) is the
generalized Fitting subgroup of G, and by induction F∗i+1(G) is the inverse image of
F∗(G/F∗i(G)). If G is soluble, then h∗(G) = h(G) is the Fitting height of G.
Does every finite group G contain a soluble subgroup K such that h∗(G) = h(K)?
P. Shumyatsky
